storyInfo: To evade capture, Reed leads everyone into a ruins, only to find by surprise that they are the remnants of the legendary Palace of Tara.

attributes.text: 'I cast my heart into my rhymes,'
'That you, in the dim coming times,'
'May know how my heart went with them... after the red-rose-bordered hem.'

attributes.content: I knew they wouldn't come looking for anyone under a pile of Catastrophe rubble.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: We have that thick mist this morning to thank. Wouldn't have made it out so easily otherwise.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Ah, careful. We don't have any protective equipment. There's a risk of infection here, if we get hurt.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: You too, Moran. Originium-rich environments are—especially dangerous to Infected.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Noted. I'll watch out.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Is Caireann... asleep?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I think she's just fallen asleep, yes, it wasn't fainting. Her breathing's very calm, I can tell. Sleep will ease her pain, if only by a little.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: But I still worry she might not make it, if we don't stop to take care of her injuries soon.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Mm.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Are... any of you disappointed?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Why would we be? Didn't you say so yourself? We've got to fight with Dublinn forces because they don't want a second 'Leader.'
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: But they've got grander goals. They won't keep making chase.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: We're used to a life of running at this point. We can bear with it.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: What about after, though? You still haven't told us what you're thinking for then.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: I don't have a very good idea yet. I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Right. There might be fewer Originium crystals, deeper into the ruins. I want to take a look, and see if we can hide ourselves anywhere for the moment.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: It's about time we all stopped for some rest.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: But aren't there people over that way?
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: They seem like normal folk, but we should steer clear anyhow. You said yourself, it's strange there's people in a place like this. We need to be careful...
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: No need.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: ...You seem so afraid. What's the matter?
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: I'm fine. Please, don't worry about me.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: (She's come here before...? Is she nearby?)
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Hey. The one over there's walking kind of strange, isn't she?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Don't look.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Oh, lord—she's—
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: She probably died—some time ago.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Her body's—just being controlled by Arts. Like the Dublinn soldiers we saw before.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Why would they control a civilian?
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: I'm not sure yet.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: —Come with me. I'll handle these dead.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: It's very dim here. Follow the stone steps—watch out for any shards of raw crystal as you go down... Moran, are you sure you're okay carrying Caireann on your back?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I'm fine. As long as your flame's lit, I can see where I'm going.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Okay. We'll head in as deep as we can. Try not to be too loud.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: It's...
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: King Gaeil's castle?

When the topic of that overthrown dynasty arises, some think of the piles upon piles of armor from fallen soldiers, while others claim its golden crown still hides beneath elaborate mechanisms, deep within the ancient forest.

Some see the towering walls of modern Victoria as a foil to the castle's vastness, paralleling the boundless inland sea of Clariside with the virtuous prosperity of the age of heroes, while at the same time lamenting its passing decay under the shadow of Victoria.
All have envisioned this ancient castle as a sorrowful tombstone to Tara, the ghost of resentment.
But it merely sits silent, on top of the hill, baring this place's heart as it was before the palace stood.
Overgrown with weeds, covered in vines.
How old is all this? Five hundred years? A thousand?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Shh... Don't wake Caireann up.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Sorry... I'm just a little shocked. No, bowled over, really.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Tell you the truth. We put on productions of different King Gaeil stories each year, we know we're descendants of the Kingdom of Tara, we know that's why we're called Tarans...
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: But no one used to believe it could all actually be true.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: There was even a legend of a forge, which fused together the weapons of every Taran soldier, and overturned the fate of the dynasty...
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: A long, long time ago... I met a man from the city who was searching all over for a traveling bard.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: He said to me, though many legends were made up by later generations, there must still be the traces of history left in those stories.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Reed, you must know plenty about that, don't you?
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Are you not fond of this place? You've been quiet ever since we came in here.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Maybe.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: When I was very young, I'd often read about the legends of Tara, until I drifted to sleep.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Be it the Victorian Royal Family's scribes, or those who wish to preserve Taran culture, they always write that it is the Draco's nature to fight.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Legends say that the first Draco to lead the Gaeils boiled dry the waters of the river to travel south, to flee his clan that slaughtered each other over the throne, and settle the lands that came to be Tara.
And legends say the Victoria's Red Dragon, the one who slayed the last nomadic Draco leader, gave his firstborn the title of King Gaeil while he still burbled in the cradle.

And legends say the Draco of Tara was thereupon imprisoned in the palace, and though the 'Exile King' cast away his crown and traveled the wilderness for twenty years, upon his return and audience with the regent, his closest family, still he was murdered.
Tara's history is full of—stories like these. The Draco's palaces, teeming with conspiracy and bloodshed.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I never longed for, or dreamed of this place. I'm... scared of it.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.text: I'm scared that—one day, I'll have to fight my sister.

attributes.content: At least... I don't see any crystal clusters from the Catastrophe in here.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: It should be safe to rest here.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Good, then. Here, Moran. Let me set Caireann down for you.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Let her sleep here, out of the wind.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: There's cover here, and the walls are sturdy. We could light a fire at night, and no one outside would notice us.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Wait, why's Reed—
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Let her take a look by herself.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.text: 'I lay down now my soldier's honor here, so that in time the soil of Tara need no longer be soaked in carmine blood, and Draco cross no swords with Draco kin.'
'Be that unless a day comes, whereupon Red Dragon's flame should lead all those that fell, our fighters from the forge to be reborn.'

attributes.content: Reed hears a faint stir.
She pulls back the hand about to touch the rusted equipment before her.
It's... alive?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: It's the sort of thing anyone could activate... Why do you find it so strange someone relit it?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Mm. She's been through here. It's not strange.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Through a gap, she sees a purple flame.
This was the palace of old. She was sure to come... and sure to mock it with laughter, no? That this... is all the legendary monarch—left us with.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Her flames burn here. That's why so many of the deceased here cannot rest in peace.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: They were simply—vagabonds who lost their way, and died of thirst too close. Awakened by the flames of death, for no reason at all.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: No... stay away.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: You're scared of that flame, too, aren't you?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I can see how you want to put it out.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Yes. It will bring pain to too many people.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: But if you truly intend on it, then I won't let you pass.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: She lit the fire of Dublinn. You know the flame you reignite could never be the same.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: She's done so many terrible things, told so many beautiful lies, but it was all necessary. She summoned thousands of Tarans to follow her lead, be they saints or criminals, nobles or thieves.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: You could never do it.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: No... I can.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I don't believe—that those sacrifices were all necessary, and I will never believe—that only her way will save the Tarans.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: But she's been the Leader since the start, since so long ago, since that great fire in Oak Grove.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: She thinks back to the battered, wounded girl who laid there on the street. Reed wanted to pull her up, get her away, but was so afraid that by a reach of the hand, she too would become naught but ashes.
And there, her elder sister walked up to the girl's side.
And asked. Do you want to live?
The sewers are right beside you. Climb down there, and those disgusting nobles will never catch you again.
Mandragora. From there she escaped, and to there, in the end, she returned.
While you—never did reach your hand to anyone. Never pulled anyone up.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Mm. If I'd reached out to her, then perhaps, things would have been different.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: To be truly saved, she should have learned—that there was so much more open to her... so much more—than the power of the malefactor, like the arsonist of that day.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Yet the fact is, you're so afraid, you even fear your own power, unable to do anything but let others control it.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: That's why... they're all disappointed in you. Why you've disappointed even your sister.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: ...No. You're wrong. You speak of nothing but the past.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I am here now. I have held others' hands in mine.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I cannot say it was me that pulled them to their feet, but if they want to walk forward, then my fire will clear the path for them. Even if they lead me with them as they go.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: If... If she could see all this, I know she wouldn't be disappointed.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: You... found your companions by mere chance.
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: In front of them, you act like the capable fighter, the orator who brings all under your banner... You pretend to have your own power.
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: But in reality, you are simply mimicking her.
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: You are nothing, can be nothing, but her shadow. She sees any method through to its extreme, while in the face of her, you are far too hesitant and weak.
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: The officers that set light to the Taran districts spring to her mind. They were boisterous in ridiculing the Tarans for their arrogance, for their protesting against injustice in Oak Grove even though they could barely read and write.
She knows. This is the very thing her sister told their teacher, that this was bound to happen.
The Victorians lit the flame of hatred by their own hands. This great fire will burn, until all is reduced to nothing.
Don't blink, her sister told her. Witness clearly for yourself how our lives are destroyed again and again.
Amidst the sea of charred corpses, the Draco who controls the fires of death lifts her hand to cast.
A purple, ice-cold blaze immediately consumes the flames that had scorched the dead.
That deathly blaze never was a true life-taker. She simply permits they climb from the ashes, to take revenge against those who destroyed their homeland.
...I have no regrets.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I had always once thought she was in the right.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: 'We will throw ourselves into the fire, give even our own lives as fuel, to build the Tarans' ideal nation in the end...'
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: So I always spoke, by her side.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: But once the fuel has burned away... will there be anyone left in her nation?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I've hesitated, rethought, run away...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I do not regret it.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: My flight took me here. I've met people, seen things, she's never seen. The things I want to say cannot be what she does.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: So I will not be afraid of the thought of her again.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I will never... be trapped within my own shadow!
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: But as you recognized this palace, were you not fearing?
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: I imagine you'd never be able to tell your 'companions' where you are bound, but the answer has long been readied in your heart.
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: If you won't become me, then how will you find your own place within Dublinn's dreams?
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: —Loughshinny... what do you want?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: And in Reed's mind are the dead who walk to them in the great fire.
...Stop.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Battered, bruised, scarred beyond recognition, yet with their thirst burning bright in their eyes.
Their revenge against the Victorian officers fulfilled, now walking to those who lit their flames.
Walk no longer...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: You are owed... your rest!
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: —By the time she reacts, those closest to her have fallen before her, the vacant sockets of their eyes all focused on her.
In the fierce flash of her firelight, the deathly flames are extinguished.
...I'm sorry, Sister. I'm sorry...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I—did not mean to ruin your Arts...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: —You've done well, Loughshinny.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: She lifts her head in fear.
For the very first time, her sister is smiling on her in commendation.
Truly, very well. Your firelight is such a dazzling one.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I always wondered. What it would take, for you to show your true strength? For you to draw the attentions of all?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Display to me your talent once again. Let me see that you truly can drive back my flames.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Will you defeat me, my beloved sister?
attributes.name: Eblana
